title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 6 March - BBC News
summary: comedy legend 's son targeted by conman .
murder charge over street stab death .
learner suffered stroke during driving lesson .
water suppliers accused of failing to plan .

documents.title: cheltenham town 1-1 notts county
text: cheltenham town 1-1 notts county

documents.title: mansfield town 1-1 lincoln city
text: mansfield town 1-1 lincoln city

documents.title: seventh arrest over leicester explosion
text: seventh arrest over leicester explosion

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has ended for today but some breaking news , sport and travel will continue to appear through the night .
we will be back again tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: extra cash for potholes
text: the bad weather has seen the number of potholes listed for repair in derbyshire rise from 120 to 2,000 , the county council said .
the authority says it is investing an extra £ 1m to tackle the problem .
over the last few weeks , the weather has been exceptionally bad with constant freezing and thawing and huge amounts of rainfall followed by blankets of heavy snow .
this causes the road to crack which is why there has been a significant rise in the number of potholes and carriageway deterioration . ''
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: goverment 'focused ' on prison safety
text: a government minister has said he is focused on tackling safety issues at a `` dangerous '' prison .

the bbc understands nine inmates have taken their own lives the past two years at hmp nottingham and labour mp for nottingham north , alex norris , told the commons , ministers needed to accept the deaths were not `` random '' .
justice minister rory stewart said there were `` a number of challenges '' in the prison .
`` we are particularly focused on the issue of safety , '' he said .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: lorry driver guilty over fatal m1 crash
text: lorry driver guilty over fatal m1 crash

documents.title: football : lichaj back for forest after ban
text: nottingham forest will be looking for a third win in a row when they travel to norwich later .
aitor karanka has defender eric lichaj ( available following a three-game suspension .
daryl murphy could be in contention to start after coming off the bench on saturday , but chris cohen is absent .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: football fans warned to avoid a47
text: fans heading into norwich for tonight 's match against nottingham forest at carrow road are being advised to find alternative routes on their way home .
the a47 between postwick and trowse will be closed from 22:00 until 06:00 overnight .
highways england is closing the stretch for road works .
follow the action with live text coverage from bbc sport and you can listen to live audio commentary with the bbc radio norfolk team on fm , mw and dab .

documents.title: toyota order 'fantastic ' for region
text: toyota 's decision to commit to building the next generation of auris in derbyshire is a `` massive boost '' for the region , the county council says .
the japanese manufacturer announced last week it would be producing the model at burnaston .
councillor tony king said : `` this latest announcement is fantastic news not only for the company and the many derbyshire residents that work there but for the county as a whole .

`` it 's a massive boost for the local supply chain and an opportunity for smaller derbyshire businesses to benefit from toyota opening its order book for the supply of services , parts and components . ''
toyota promised to invest £ 240m in upgrading burnaston last march .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: animal charity defends use of shock collars
text: a charity has defended the use of collars which give pets an electric shock .
feline friends , based in derbyshire , say the collars - known as electronic containment fences - are essential to keep animals away from dangerous areas such as busy roads .
the charity spoke out after reports in the national newspapers that environment secretary michael gove is considering banning the collars .
the rspca is also opposed to the use of electronic training devices .
eric mccarrison , a trustee of the charity , said : `` people who put these containment fences in love their pets and want to protect them .
`` i have used the fences for 10 years now and i am only aware of my dogs having one accidental static charge of the wire . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: company fined over illegal waste site
text: a nottinghamshire company has been fined £ 15,000 for operating an illegal waste site near sandy lane in worksop .
yorkshire waste services ltd , of gateford road , was also ordered to pay costs of £ 7,200 .
the environment agency told mansfield magistrates ' court the site was a fire risk because a `` significant quantity '' of baled textile waste was being stored there .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: breakingm1 crash death driver convicted
text: ryszard masierak , one of two lorry drivers who were involved in a motorway crash which left eight people dead on the m1 , has been convicted at reading crown court of causing death by dangerous driving .
the crash , in august , killed eight people who were travelling in a minibus from nottingham to london , to catch a coach to disneyland , paris .

documents.title: bin collections resume after bad weather
text: derbyshire dales district council tweets
bins update 6 march | the catch-up continued today alongside scheduled collections .
please continue to leave out any missed containers apart from garden waste which has been suspended .
here 's the full schedule >
mine and my neighbors ' recycling collection was not carried out yesterday morning-tuesday is our normal collection day .
when will this be rectified ?
thanks .
hi freya , we 're still catching up with recycling , please leave your containers out , we 'll be able to provide a further update from serco later today
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: football : flitcroft set for mansfield bow
text: mansfield town boss david flitcroft takes charge of his first game for the club against local rivals lincoln city later .
flitcroft , 44 , was named stags manager last week following the resignation of steve evans .
he had been due to take charge of his first game at the weekend , but the match with stevenage was postponed due to the poor weather .
a debut win for flitcroft tonight against danny cowley 's side could lift the stags into the automatic promotion places .
elsewhere in league two , notts county travel to cheltenham .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: tribute benches for miners unveiled
text: two handcrafted , illustrated benches , made in tribute to miners , have been added to the memorial garden in a nottinghamshire country park .
the seats , in gedling country park , have been unveiled by former miners from gedling colliery and children from christ the king school , in arnold , who helped design them .
the benches will join other memorabilia in the park , including a `` flaming tree '' sculpture , as a nod to the site 's previous use as a colliery .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: mp 's concern over court journey time
text: the closure of a court is impacting on justice in derbyshire , according to an mp .
the government closed the court house in buxton in 2016 , with cases moved to chesterfield (
labour mp for high peak ruth george said : `` some of my constituents now have to travel 40 miles to chesterfield .
`` the police say it takes them a whole day to take someone to court instead of less than half a day .
`` that is impacting the number of offenders they can bring to court . ''
justice secretary david gauke said some courts were not being fully utilised and the government has decisions to make over `` scarce '' resources .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: dinner lady hopes to become national champion
text: nottinghamshire dinner lady donna spiers is sharpening her knives and lining up her ladles in the hope of becoming school chef of the year 2018 this week .
donna , who works at alderman white academy , in bramcote , already holds the east midlands title and will compete at the final in stratford-upon-avon this week .
she told the bbc : `` i 'm very determined .
i 'd love to come in the top three but to win would be amazing . ''

documents.title: pictures : freezing weather causes potholes
text: earlier we mentioned that the freezing weather had caused a `` plague of potholes '' in parts of nottinghamshire .
here are some photos of the potholes in hucknall .
some of them have recently been repaired , but many residents have complained that the repairs are not good enough .
nottinghamshire county council has recently approved £ 2,000,000 for road maintenance and improvements .
author: Hayley Compton
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: england 's youngs set for quick return
text: england 's youngs set for quick return

documents.title: tigers flanker williams out for up to six weeks
text: leicester tigers flanker mike williams could be out for up to six weeks after suffering a hamstring injury in sunday 's win at worcester .
williams departed in the 29th minute of the match after trying to recover an interception .
mikey sort of stumbled and fell over chasing back on that intercept and has a significant strain which will probably be in the vicinity of four to six [ weeks ] .
there is better news for winger jonah holmes .
he also left the action at sixways with a hamstring problem , but should be available for leicester 's next game against wasps .
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: hundreds of pies arrive in melton mowbray
text: a total of 963 pies have arrived at st mary 's church in melton mowbray today for judging at the british pie awards .
the awards are a national celebration of pies in all their varieties and have been running since 2009 .
from steak and kidney to chicken tikka , a huge variety of pies are up for judging , with 60 new pie makers having entered this year .
results of the winners will be announced friday .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: awkward league two nomination for evans
text: awkward league two nomination for evans

documents.title: state-of-the-art sports facility opens
text: a state-of-the-art sports facility at the university of derby has opened to the public .
the human performance unit includes hi-tech support such as motion capture technology to improve sporting performance .
cyclist leigh timmis has been using the unit for months as he prepares to make an attempt on the record for the fastest cycle across europe .
`` this has become a lifestyle change , '' he said .
`` it 's not just changed how i 'm approaching the record - it 's everything around it . ''
author: Navtej Johal
East Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: community centre organises women 's event
text: women from different faiths and communities in nottingham attended an event to celebrate international women 's day .
the annual event is actually held on 8 march , but the vine community centre in hyson green hosted their event today .
it commemorates the movement for women 's rights .
guest speakers included dame asha khemka , principal at west college nottinghamshire in mansfield , broxtowe borough councillor halimah khaled and nottingham barrister usha sood .
nottinghamshire police and nottinghamshire fire and rescue service also attended .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: blood stocks hit by weather
text: the nhs is urging more blood donors to come forward because the recent bad weather has hit stocks .
now extra appointments have been created at the blood centres in leicester and nottingham to try to replenish supplies .
author: Rob Sissons
East Midlands Today Reporter

documents.title: comedy legend 's son targeted by conman
text: comedy legend 's son targeted by conman

documents.title: man punched in attempted robbery
text: a 52-year-old man was punched in the face during an attempted robbery in bulwell , police said .
the victim was approached by a gang of men who demanded his wallet but when he refused , they punched him .
it happened in commercial road at about 20:00 on 22 february .
nottinghamshire police said they are linking the attempted robbery with another incident involving the same victim and a group of men which happened a week earlier on the same road .
this happened at about 20:15 on 15 february when the same man was approached by a group of men .
he believed two of them were planning to assault him and take his bike but they shouted abuse at him before leaving empty handed .
the suspects are about 18 years old , white or mixed race and were wearing dark hooded clothing .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: mum struggles to live in her own home
text: cate whitmore from market harborough is hoping to raise money to help her adapt her home after being left paralysed .
cate has almost no feeling below the navel after falling downstairs while cleaning a friend 's home .
now she ca n't climb the stairs of her own terraced house , and has had to convert her front room into her bedroom as well as travelling to use a friend 's shower .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: woman was 'britain 's first female bouncer '
text: a 5ft 4in woman from chaddesden , in derby , claims she was britain 's first female bouncer .
delia el-hosayny , who has now retired from her work , started her career in 1985 .
`` the scariest moment i ever had was when i got shot , '' she said .
`` [ the bullet ] was meant for a doorman who had chucked somebody out earlier who said he would come back to shoot him - and he was true to his word .
`` the bullet ricocheted off the wall and hit me in the knee .
it put me out of work for a couple of days . ''
she was also stabbed in the neck by a drug dealer in moss side , manchester and delivered a baby in a nightclub toilet .
`` you have to be tough .
i 've to grit my teeth and fight like a man .
but if people get to know me , i 'm a pussycat . ''
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: paedophile hunter 'enjoys ' the chase
text: a paedophile hunter has been telling the bbc how he enjoys the outcome of stings he sets up .
gavin , who lives in nottinghamshire , creates fake online profiles of teenage girls and waits to be approached by men .
`` when we get all the information we need , we arrange to meet , print out the chat logs and get the evidence , '' he said .
`` i actually enjoy seeing the outcome of all the hard work i have done to get them to that point and watching them get taken away by the police . ''
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: snow and cold weather causes potholes
text: the freezing weather has caused a `` plague of potholes '' to appear across nottinghamshire in recent weeks , according to the rac .
the breakdown firm said the `` toxic combination of high water levels , ice and snow is causing many road surfaces to crumble causing potholes to open up . ''
many have appeared in west bridgford and there have been complaints in hucknall that the repairs have not been good enough .
last year nottinghamshire county council fixed more than 70,000 potholes in the county .
the local authority has recently approved £ 2,000,000 for road maintenance and improvements .
councillor john cottee , who is responsible for roads in the county , said : `` the pothole which is 40mm deep or deeper , we will instantly fill it with a quick fix .
`` we will then come back to it at a later date and repair it .
the down side is , when it is freezing temperatures or below 3c we ca n't repair it probably , we have to just fill because it would go starlight away . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: calls to save 'historic ' wagon warehouse
text: calls have been made to save a former wagon repair warehouse which is planned to be knocked down to make way for a major new retail development in derby .

conservation experts and derby residents believe the 150-year-old building and local landmark '' - recently the former home of the derby fireplace company before the firm closed last year - is a proud part of the city 's railway heritage and efforts should be made to keep it .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: broken down hgv still causing delays
text: there are still some delays near the a50 toyota island in derby .
the broken down hgv on the # a38 has now been cleared and all lanes re-opened between # a50 # toyotaisland and # a516 near # derby .
delays are clearing steadily .
thanks for your patience .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: promising footballer 'died from nut allergy '
text: a teenager with a promising football career ahead of him collapsed and died from a suspected nut allergy while out with friends , say his parents .
nottingham forest fan james turnbull , 15 , from bramcote , was just about to take his gcses this year with aspirations to join the derby county community trust football and education programme .
author: Nottingham Post

documents.title: teen 'was punched by runner '
text: police are appealing for witnesses after a 16-year-old boy was punched in the face by a runner .
the alleged attack happened on old station close , etwall at around 17.30 on 19 february .
the boy and his friend were on bikes when they were involved in an altercation with the runner who then apparently punched him , causing a split lip which required five stitches .
the runner was described as a white man , aged between 40-50 years , about 6ft tall with grey hair .
he was said to be wearing white running shoes with a red/pink hooded top and dark-coloured bottoms .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: fan plans minute 's applause for dad
text: a mansfield town fan is calling on supporters to join him in giving a minute 's applause for his father , a `` super stag '' who died last week .
ashley coupe said many fans would recognise his dad , ian , from matches .
`` he was a massive stags fan , attending every home game for many years , '' he said .
mr coupe is calling on fans to pay tribute in the 59th minute of tonight 's fixture against lincoln city , which was his father 's age , as a celebration of his life .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: water suppliers accused of failing to plan
text: water regulator ofwat has accused water suppliers of failing to plan properly for the bad weather .

severn trent said its teams have been working `` tirelessly '' to fix as many leaks as possible - including one that saw homes suffer low pressure in arnold , nottingham - following what it said is a 4,000 % increase in burst pipes .
jonathan smith , from the company , said : `` we have found the burst that was causing the problem in arnold .
this has been a problem for us across our entire patch .
those pressures should be getting back to normal and we ca n't apologise enough . ''
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: fan 'troubled ' by word 'sheep ' on bus ticket
text: a nottingham forest fan said he was `` troubled '' to find the word `` sheep '' printed on his bus ticket as he travelled to a match on saturday .
rich fisher said : `` the irony with being presented with a ticket with a name associated with forest 's rivals , derby county , was not lost on me . ''
anthony carver-smith from nottingham city transport said the word was part of a randomly-generated sequence printed on tickets to prevent fraud .
`` it 's a really quick way for a driver to check the tickets are valid .
we have other animals in there as well - hippo , mouse and puppy , '' he said .
`` it certainly is n't intended as any offence towards forest fans .
we have a list of offensive words that we ca n't use - we may add `` sheep '' to that list now . ''
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: plan to stop takeaways near schools
text: there are plans to stop take-aways opening near nottingham schools to try to combat obesity .
it is believed there are about 364 fast food outlets in the city and the city council is looking to bring in a policy to block new applicants within 400m of a secondary school .
however , the scheme would need government approval .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: question marks hang over brailsford
text: question marks hang over the future career of team sky 's general manager sir dave brailsford following a damning report from mps .

the digital , culture , media and sport ( dcms ) select committee publication effectively accused shardlow-born brailsford - the man credited with turning cycling into the driving force behind britain 's ascent into an olympic superpower - of cheating .
and if not cheating the actual rules in the strictest sense , then certainly the spirit of them .
`` crossing the ethical line '' is how the mps put it .
could this prove the final straw for brailsford ?
will he , as the mps seem to suggest , `` take responsibility '' and resign ?
author: Dan Roan
BBC Sports editor

documents.title: 'dozens ' of trampoline injuries
text: dozens of people have been injured at trampoline parks in the east midlands since 2015 .
a freedom of information request to all ambulance trusts by the bbc found there were 83 call-outs in the region over the last three years , and more than half of those were for children .
the health and safety executive says it will only investigate if there is a serious incident .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: learner driver suffered stroke at 17
text: ashley martin from loughborough , suffered a stroke at the age of 17 .
he was on a driving lesson , travelling in his instructor 's car through loughborough , when he suddenly felt cold and numb .
at first , he put it down to dodgy air conditioning .
but when he reached up to adjust the levels , his left hand flopped off the steering wheel and his instructor immediately told him to pull over .
he was taken to the stroke ward at leicester royal infirmary and has been very fortunate to make a remarkable recovery .
seven years on , ashley and his girlfriend emma hackney will take on the stroke association 's 5km resolution run at braunstone park on sunday 11 march to raise vital funds for the charity .
author: Sophie Cook
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: m1 delays caused by broken down lorry
text: oh dear .
two lanes on the m1 south are closed between junctions 26 and 25 , for derby and nottingham , because of a broken down lorry .
it 's causing queues in the area .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: derbyshire school closures
text: three schools are closed across derbyshire .
author: Ben Truslove
BBC News Online

documents.title: leicestershire campaigner wants to see the end of hiv
text: a campaigner from market harborough is trying to encourage more gay men to take prep , a medication that prevents the spread of hiv .
prep is currently not available on the nhs but can be bought privately .
mark mason began taking prep nearly three years ago , but has had to overcome a lot of stigma while sharing his message :
there 's a stigma with prep that you were sleeping around .
what i want to get across is we have loads of tools available and if we can use this together we can be the generation that is the beginning of the end of hiv . ''
author: Matt Smith
BBC Radio Leicester Breakfast Show producer

documents.title: claims firms could be accountable for holiday fraud
text: companies that encourage holiday-makers to make false claims about getting ill while travelling abroad could be held criminally responsible .
yesterday , leon roberts and jade muzoka , from derby , were each handed a 26-week suspended sentence for fraud after admitting lying about contracting food poisoning on a turkish break .
district judge jonathan taaffe said there could be grounds for a criminal case against the legal firm that suggested to the couple their claim was , `` easy money '' .
raj sumal , head of the fraud team at flint bishop solicitors , in derby , agreed .
`` the [ firms ] should be held accountable because they are the ones who are actually driving this , '' he said .
`` ultimately , the compensation is there for individuals who have genuinely suffered . ''
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News

documents.title: watch : east midlands weather forecast
text: a cloudy start , with some sunshine breaking through later in the day .

documents.title: murder charge over street stab death
text: murder charge over street stab death

documents.title: water supply returns for many
text: if you 're one of those in the east midlands who had no water overnight here 's the latest on the supply issues from severn trent .
good news - we 've finished our repair to a pipe in north derbyshire that was affecting supplies in ashbourne and belper .
we 're now working to get water back into the area .
latest here :
water came on at 5am this morning , then off again at 7 .
any updates please .

please do direct message us your full address and we will investigate this for you .
thanks

hi adrian , we 're really sorry to hear you are still having supply issues .
the problem has now been fixed in your area however you may experience intermittent supplies as the network refills .
it should return to normal shortly .
many thanks .
the problem has not been fixed !
this is such a poor service .
your information for customers is incorrect or non-existent .
i 'm sorry about this adrian , we are getting reports from the area and are currently investigating this , once we have more information we will update everyone .
dan
can you give us an update please on earl sterndale ?
as you can imagine this is incredibly difficult 4 days no water , desperate
hi adrian , really sorry you 're still without water .
your area is back on so hopefully your home will have water some time this morning .
it will be intermittent to start with as the network fills up , and can take time in hilly areas .
for more :
we seem to have no water mappleton ashbourne or is the pressure just low ? ?
hi tony , the repair has been completed on the burst pipe in the ashbourne area but the return of a full supply is taking far longer than anticipated , or you may recieve an intermittent suply .
please see the latest update at thank you , kerry
hi still no water here in mappleton
hi tony , the repair has been completed on the burst pipe in the ashbourne area but the return of a full supply is taking far longer than anticipated .
we 're doing everything we can to resolve this .
please keep checking our website here :
thanks for all you efforts for getting the water up and running .
we are back to normal now
thats brilliant news , thank you for letting us know tony .
can you let me know what area you are in .
jen .
ashbourne derbyshire , is there any plan to cut the service again today ? ?
hi tony , we 're doing everything we can do return normal supply to our customers .
you may find you have intermittent supply whilst we fix the problem .
you can find the latest information here : thank you , louise .
are you going to bring bottled water to the area ?
the shops have run out
hello , please can you advise where you are and we can let you know what updates we have , many thanks

hi , the problem in ashbourne has now been repaired however you may experience intermittent supplies as the network refills but it should be back to normal shortly .

hi there , we are sorry that you have been unable to open your cafe today .

thank you
any update on water availability at de61es yet ?
hi we have opened a bottled water station for customers in the ashbourne area who are still waiting for water to reach their taps .
if you are without water you can collect bottled water from the shawcroft car park , de6 1rt until 10pm this evening

we 're sorry for the distruption that 's been caused .
full update here :

you are welcome claire !
update on the le8 0pn area please

please keep an eye on our website for updates - many thanks for your patience during this time .
update on s187sp please .
no one answers the stw emergency phone number .
it just cuts you off after ringing once !
hi trudi , i have just responded to your earlier message .
thank you , kerry

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live updates
text: morning everyone .
we 'll be here throughout the day to bring you the latest news , travel and weather from across the east midlands .
author: Jennifer Harby
BBC News
